rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/67.171.38.56|67.171.38.56]] ([[User talk:67.171.38.56|talk]]) to last version by BronzeEagle
added link to Alfred Kinsey article

/* Female Genital Cutting and Human Rights */ as worded in legislation
rv suspected vandalism. That section has been in for quite some time. Why not long in and post on the discussion page why you feel it should be removed?
We're not a link repository, but I still see no reason for removing this particular reference.
[[WP:NOT]] a link repository; there is no reason to link to a nonacademic article when there are much better sources already cited.
This external link cites its sources and comes from a very popular website that gets millions of hits a week. I can see no justification for removing it.
I blocked jguk just last week. Am I blocking myself? This link is terrible.

if you want to move or merge it, get agreement first. Also, FGM already mentioned in that paragraph

/* Cultural background */ added that most scholars reject it

opening paragraph already contains the latter term, and no evidence the former is commonly used

added references section, plus one reference and some further reading
Female circumcision moved to Female genital cutting
rv: Get consensus from more people first?
redirect to female genital cutting, as per talk page
/* Clitoridotomy */ change absolute, dubious statement to more moderate one
/* Clitoridotomy */ More accurate information about sunna circumcision
/* Clitoridotomy */ One link fixed, and other changes. See talk page.
/* Ending forms of female circumcision */ NPOV + correct quirky capitalisation
/* Clitoridectomy */ clarify - clitoridectomy always means excision of the clitoris. type II is clitoridectomy + optional labiectomy (sp?).
/* Clitoridotomy */ clarify relationship to type I
/* Clitoridotomy */ update to closer match WHO definition
/* Clitoridotomy */ clean up again - no need to beat the testimonial thing to death, the links are there
/* Clitoridotomy */ more neutral phrasing that does not imply a link
/* Clitoridotomy */ A link shows that the fear of masturbation has declined in the medical profession. More details about how the practice is promoted today.
/* Areas of practice */ irrelevant info corrected. no hint of the practice in turkey but it prevails among israeli bedouins
/* Clitoridotomy */ this is at least 50 years old, obviously not "Now"
/* Clitoridotomy */ more details about McDonald's paper
/* Clitoridotomy */ add date of Rathmann, removed speculation about violation of genital integrity being perceived in the 50s.
/* Clitoridotomy */ added some detail and removed "lately" (since Rathmann dates to 1959)
/* Clitoridotomy */ No original research, just neutral language and a link to information that attitudes towards masturbation have changed in the last 50 years.
/* Clitoridotomy */ suggesting a possible reason violates [[WP:NOR]]
/* Different forms */ heading fixed, Links of the Clitoral hood removal webpage exposed.
/* Clitoridotomy */ Reference restored. Please let the reader decide on the basis of the evidence.
rv. sentence implies cause and effect.
/* Clitoridotomy */ Link provided for the declining practice of circumcision.
/* Clitoridotomy */ Link provided for the declining practice of circumcision.
/* Clitoridotomy */ neutral statement which doesn't make broad and unsourced assumptions
/* Clitoridotomy */ partial rv. the sentence is neutral as is. the alternative presents it as devious and improbable.
/* Clitoridotomy */ restoring specific information. The practice of female genital trimming goes on today. It's not just a phenomen of the previous century.
Clitoridectomy: "the west" implied too many nations that didn't practice FGM.
/* Clitoridotomy */ Modification or removal of statements which would have the procedure confused with traditional practices in other cultures as well as other changes.
rm POV and unsourced comments on Australian aborigines
/* Clitoridotomy */ remove POV which implies cause and effect, and hyper-skepticism which is also POV
/* Clitoridotomy */Adjusting the wording to flow better and not present assertions or testimonials as if they were facts. For all we know, the testimonials might be bogus.
/* Areas of practice */ +details regarding Middle East, with CSmonitor reference
/* Clitoridotomy */ remove POV and original research conclusions
/* Clitoridotomy */ making explicit an implication of the changing justification for female circumcision, passage rearranged; some repetition removed.
Removing link to page in Yiddish
incorporate more accurate text in proper place
Female genital mutilation moved to Female circumcision

/* Cultural background */ - The Israeli government accepts Beta Israel as Jews.

/* Cultural background */ Beta Israel practice a different faith, and their status as Jews is disputed. And if people don't know who they are, that's what the link is for.
I agree on Beta Israel, but you'll need better grounds for removing information. reverting that part.
rv. The quote is unnecessary, and it's source (MEMRI) is biased. The list is a list of *religions*, not of peoples or places. Furthermore, most readers wouldn't even know what "beta israel" was.
rv. I fail to see any justification for removing the information.
Menri is a Biased organisation according tot he EU, Mayor of London and a great number of scholars, don't talk nonsense.
A biased source according to whom, you? Please review [[WP:NPOV]].
/* Cultural background */ Memri is a biased source

corrected the statement that cltoridotomy has not occurred since 1958 in the US: in fact a number of surgeons specialize in it

not only women perform FGM, and so changed to gender neutral term; minor grammar

practice was "rare" in West - not "practiced until well into the 20th century". See reference at clitoridectomy
our opinionated friend's point is made elsewhere in the article
bold links per mos, having two links to the same page (one via redir) seems appropriate as the page covers two different subjects
linking to the original source, which is the Right Thing to do
* [http://www.state.gov/g/wi/rls/rep/9276.htm U.S. State Department estimates of prevalence of FGM in Africa] + removing map with dubious copyright status
removed pending source (I'm skeptical there will ever be a source)
spitting in public is "inappropriate" - I don't think it's POV to accurately describe strong generally held sentiments
The whitehouse.org site is not the "real" White House; don't want to confuse people with that, even if it is funny.

the fact is that the anti-circumcision people are in the overwhelming majority.
